data.title: Rita Wilson Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Rita Wilson with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Of Greek and Bulgarian ancestry

Family changed surname to Wilson after a local street in Southern California

Began her modeling career at 14, when she was discovered by a photographer

Made a 1981 guest appearance on the sitcom Bosom Buddies as Peter Scolari's Satan-worshipping girlfriend

First starring role came in 1985's comedy Volunteers, in which she played a Peace Corps worker, opposite Tom Hanks, whom she married three years later

Along with Hanks, served as coproducer for the 2002 hit My Big Fat Greek Wedding; convinced Hanks to produce the movie after seeing Nia Vardalos's one-woman show

Debuted on Broadway in 2006 playing murderess Roxie Hart in the musical Chicago

Active in several charitable causes and organizations, including the Moffitt Cancer Center
